item.Name: object uses only own static lightmap
search cardinal direction lightmaps on failure
extension of parent#object uses parent's markers
object is always on the ceiling
sample enviroment lighting only ignore object lighting
effects created by this object do not spawn objects in multiplayer
does not collide with camera#force camera not to collide with object. By default small sweetener objects do not collide
force collide with camera#force the camera to collide with this object, By default small sweetener objects do not collide
damage not blocked by obstructions#AOE damage being applied to this object does not test for obstrutions.
grab parent object in forge editing
never use imposter for shadow generation

_field_real.name: bounding radius#If you edit this field manually, beware that the render model is no longer respected for radius calculation and that you need to set the bounding offset as well.
dynamic light sphere radius#sphere to use for dynamic lights and shadows. only used if not 0

_field_real_point_3d.name: dynamic light sphere offset#only used if radius not 0

_field_explanation.name: only set this tag if you want to override the default collision damage values in globals.globals

_field_tag_reference.name: melee sound#this is the sound that is made when I am meleed. This overrides the sweetener sound of my material.

_field_real.name: self-destruct time:seconds#if non-zero, any instances of this object will destroy themselves after this many seconds.

_field_string_id.name: ai type name#used for combat dialogue, etc.
interaction name#if you checked the consider for interaction flag, type what interaction the AI should do with this object (NYI - you can use any)

item.Name: invert#result of function is one minus actual result
mapping does not controls active#the curve mapping can make the function active/inactive
always active#function does not deactivate when at or below lower bound
random time offset#function offsets periodic function input by random value between 0 and 1
always exports value#when this function is deactivated, it still exports its value
turn off with uses magnitude#the function will be turned off if the value of the turns_off_with function is 0

_field_string_id.name: import name#if you leave this field blank then you can set this function's input value with the hs_function object_set_function_variable
turn off with#if the specified function is off, so is this function
ranged interpolation name#if you have the ranged button checked

_field_real.name: min value#function must exceed this value (after mapping) to be active 0. means do nothing

_field_block.name: interpolation

item.Name: fractional#covers a fixed fraction of the distance to the target on each update

_field_real.name: linear travel time:s#used by constant velocity

_field_block._field_explanation: the damping ratio is c/(2*sqrt(k)). if this ratio is: = 0 : oscillates forever < 1 : oscillates with decreasing amplitude = 1 : reaches the target precisely and quickly (no oscillation) > 1 : reaches the target slowly the higher the value of k, the quicker the system will reach the target value

_field_real.name: spring k#used by damped spring determines acceleration by displacement
spring c#used by damped spring determines damping based on velocity
fraction:0-1#used by fractional how mush of the distance to the target to cover each update

_field_long_integer.name: runtime interpolator to object function mapping*!

_field_real_bounds.name: selection bounds#if the switch function is between these values, this function will be picked

item.Name: update state animation and keyframe rigid bodies every frame

_field_tag_reference.name: type^
_field_tag_reference.validtags: ligh, gldf, ltvl, effe, lsnd, lens, cpem, egfd, decs

item.Name: force always on#when this flag is clear we only create the attachment when the function object function is active or set to empty string
effect size scale from object scale
works on land#drives on an extruded version of everything physical in your level

_field_string_id.name: variant name#if empty, may be used by any model variant

item.Name: blend in hsv#blends colors in hsv rather than rgb space
...more colors#blends colors through more hues (goes the long way around the color wheel)

_field_block.name: multiplayer object
_field_block._field_explanation: Set which game engines you desire this object to appear in
Type pertains to how you want the game engine to handle this object Certain flags applicable only to certain object types, should be self evident
These fields are only used for goal area objects with boundaries, and for respawn zones
These fields are used for default spawning times and remapping
These are respawn zone weights, used only for respawn zones

_field_block.name: falloff function#Multiplier applied to weight (domain is center to radius, range should be 0 to 1).

_field_block._field_explanation: These fields are only used for defining certain, special markers to use for positional locations if the default position (object origin) is not sufficient
If this object is intended to spawn something, the object it spawns should be specified here
These are default shaders used for boundary geometry
These are custom shaders used for spherical boundary geometry
These are custom shaders used for cylindrical boundary geometry
These are custom shaders used for box boundary geometry

_field_tag_reference.name: simulation_interpolation#Set to a specific interpolation definition, or leave blank to inherit the default for the object type (there are defaults for bipeds, vehicles, and crates in multiplayer_globals). To disable interpolation on a particular object whose type has interpolation by default, set this reference to the special disable_interpolation.simulation_interpolation tag.

_field_block.name: spawn effects
_field_block._field_explanation: Effect played when an object of this type spawns in during each game mode. Unlike creation effect, it is only played when the object spawns in through certain methods, not whenever one is created.

_field_tag_reference.name: multiplayer spawn effect#effect played when this object spawns in MP games
survival spawn effect#effect played when this object spawns in Firefight games
campaign spawn effect#effect played when this object spawns in Campaign games

item.Name: detonation max time if attached#If attach happens timeout is set to timer.high
allow deceleration below final velocity#use for bouncing projectiles that also have initial/final velocity so that can reliably come to rest.
supports tethering#projectile waits for trigger unlatch before immediately detonating
damage_not_predictable_by_clients#used on the focus rifle to disable observer shield flash prediction for a high-dps weapon that does low damage per projectile
collides with physics-only surfaces#aka sphere-only collision. Use this for projectiles that you want to bounce smoothly up stairs, but don't use it for projectiles that may come to rest on stairs
detonates when attached to objects#when projectiles move slowly enough they attach to objects or come to rest. Check this for projectiles that don't normally attach to things like frag grenades
cannot be detached by equipment#armor lock will not detach these projectiles - for the airstrike
does not collide with world geometry#this gun shoots through schools
is collectible#Projectile is collectible by projectile collector equipment
continuous damage while attached and tethered
combinations of projectiles from different weapons or different bursts of the same weapon will not trigger super combine detonation
distance based damage scaling uses damage range low bounds#damage scales from 1.f --> 0.f between 'damage range - low' --> 'damage range - high'
skip object first tick#similar to Disable instantaneous first tick, but there's actually two types of ticks
Use projectile radius for thickness testing#IF THIS IS OFF, NO THICKNESS OR CHUBBY TESTS ARE PERFORMED.
Expensive chubby test#Will only be active if thickness testing is ON.
Use play collision#Will use simple and smooth collision mesh.
Highlight projectile in vision mode#Makes the projectile show up as an enemy in vision mode
biped proximity enemies only#modifies behavior of 'detonation biped proximity'
always use localized physics#overrides early mover localize projectiles
never use localized physics#overrides early mover localize projectiles
after first bounce off floor{after first bounce}
after first bounce off any surface
silent#ai will not respond to this sound
loud#ai can hear this sound at any range

_field_real.name: detonation biped proximity:wu#if >0, both 'detonation timer starts' + a biped must be within this proximity for condition to be met; see 'biped proximity enemies only' flag
max lifetime to detonate:seconds#if >0, projectile will detonate regardless of other conditions after this total time
arming time:seconds#won't detonate before this time elapses
danger stimuli radius:world units#Overrides the danger radius when non-zero for stimuli related danger radius calculations.

_field_short_integer.name: danger group burst count#The number of projectiles in this burst before this burst is considered dangerous
danger group burst max count#The maximum number of projectiles we allow in a group

_field_real.name: minimum velocity:world units per second#detonates when slowed below this velocity
maximum range:world units#detonates after travelling this distance
bounce maximum range:world units#detonates after travelling this distance, but is reset after a bounce. Combines with maximum range
max latch time to detonate:seconds#projectile will detonate regardless of weapon latching after this total time
max latch time to arm:seconds#projectile will arm itself regardless of detonation mode if latched for this amount of time.

item.Name: silent#ai will not respond to this sound
loud#ai can hear this sound at any range

_field_real_bounds.name: super det. range:world units#The range within which supercombine will happen - outside this range, no supercombine

_field_tag_reference.name: super det. behavior#An equipment reference that is attached to the target upon super detonation

_field_real.name: tether release safety delay#if the weapon the projectile is tethered to loses its owner, this amount of time will pass before detonation

plugin._field_explanation: A detonating tethered projectile attached to an object will use the 'super' versions of damage ie 'super attached detonation damage' instead of 'attached detonation damage'.

_field_tag_reference.name: detonation behavior#An equipment reference that is attached to the target upon detonation

_field_real.name: material effect radius#radius within we will generate material effects

plugin._field_explanation: damage range low is unused unless 'distance based damage scaling uses damage range low bounds' flag is true.

_field_real.name: air gravity scale#the proportion of normal gravity applied to the projectile when in air.

_field_real_bounds.name: air damage range:world units#the range over which damage is scaled when the projectile is in air.

_field_real.name: water gravity scale#the proportion of normal gravity applied to the projectile when in water.

_field_real_bounds.name: water damage range:world units#the range over which damage is scaled when the projectile is in water.

_field_real.name: initial velocity:world units per second#bullet's velocity when inflicting maximum damage
final velocity:world units per second#bullet's velocity when inflicting minimum damage
indirect fire velocity:world units per second#base velocity used for ballistics calculations for indirect firing.
ai velocity scale (normal):[0-1]#scale on the initial velocity when fired by the ai on normal difficulty (0 defaults to 1.0
ai velocity scale (heroic):[0-1]#scale on the initial velocity when fired by the ai on heroic difficulty (0 defaults to 1.0)
ai velocity scale (legendary):[0-1]#scale on the initial velocity when fired by the ai on legendary difficulty (0 defaults to 1.0)
ai guided angular velocity scale (normal):[0-1]#scale on the guided angular velocity when fired by the ai on normal difficulty (0 defaults to 1.0
ai guided angular velocity scale (legendary):[0-1]#scale on the guided angular velocity when fired by the ai on legendary difficulty (0 defaults to 1.0)

_field_angle.name: guided angular velocity at rest:degrees per second

_field_real_bounds.name: acceleration range:world units#what distance range the projectile goes from initial velocity to final velocity

_field_block.name: old material responses{material responses}!
_field_block._field_explanation: (if the potential result, below, fails to happen)

item.Name: only against units (except giants){only against units}
never against units (except giants){never against units}

_field_angle.name: angular noise:degrees#the angle of incidence is randomly perturbed by at most this amount to simulate irregularity.

_field_real.name: velocity noise:world units per second#the velocity is randomly perturbed by at most this amount to simulate irregularity.
initial friction#the fraction of the projectile's velocity lost on penetration
parallel friction#the fraction of the projectile's velocity parallel to the surface lost on impact
perpendicular friction#the fraction of the projectile's velocity perpendicular to the surface lost on impact

item.Name: only against units (except giants){only against units}
never against units (except giants){never against units}

_field_angle.name: angular noise:degrees#the angle of incidence is randomly perturbed by at most this amount to simulate irregularity.

_field_real.name: velocity noise:world units per second#the velocity is randomly perturbed by at most this amount to simulate irregularity.
initial friction#the fraction of the projectile's velocity lost on penetration
parallel friction#the fraction of the projectile's velocity parallel to the surface lost on impact
perpendicular friction#the fraction of the projectile's velocity perpendicular to the surface lost on impact

_field_block.name: conical spread
_field_block._field_explanation: projectile_count = yaw_count*pitch_count This block has no effect if _projectile_disable_instantaneous_first_tick is set or projectile has not been fired from a weapon.

_field_real.name: distribution exponent#exp==.5 even distribution, exp==1 halo2 distribution, exp>1== weighted towards center

_field_tag_reference.name: grounded friction settings#If not present, the default from global.globals is used.
killcam parameters# if not present, first person will be used.

_field_long_block_index.name: Attachment Index#Sound attachment to affect - leave empty for main body
